intro: Perymenium grande var. grande, commonly known as the large perymenium, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its robust, upright stems and compound leaves with a distinctive, fern-like appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
